definition: lit. whole sky, a multitude of stars

sentences.english: Isn't that fun? I enjoy lying on the field at night and looking up at the starry sky.
sentences.chinese: 馬可大哥喜歡夜晚時分躺在營地上，看著滿天星斗。

sentences.english: Million account Qionglu drunk, shadow star shake and crumble.
sentences.chinese: 千軍萬帳中酣歌豪飲人早已醉，滿天繁星搖搖欲墜。

sentences.english: Sun follows day. night, stars, and moon;
sentences.chinese: 日月如梭，星月滿天之後必然是黎明。

sentences.english: Why are Rainbows not all Over the Sky?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼不見虹霓滿天掛？

sentences.english: With ginkgo leaves flying in the autumn sky , Principal wrote words on a piece.
sentences.chinese: 秋日銀杏葉滿天，校長執筆樹下籤。

sentences.english: They are talking out of turn, they are throwing paper.
sentences.chinese: 他們口無遮攔，把紙張扔得滿天飛。

sentences.english: This all over the sky snow, against the snow only farewell.
sentences.chinese: 這滿天冬雪，迎着雪花只爲告別。

sentences.english: I also love looking at the stars on a clear night.
sentences.chinese: 馬可大哥喜歡夜晚時分躺在營地上，看著滿天星斗。

sentences.english: I have stars in the sky but oh for my little lamp unlit in my house.
sentences.chinese: 我擁有滿天星辰，但我爲我家居未點亮的小燈而輕嘆。

sentences.english: Heavy snow is sifting onto the ground.
sentences.chinese: 滿天大雪撒落在大地上。

sentences.english: The night sky is now gorgeous with billions of stars.
sentences.chinese: 我是在一個滿天星斗的冬夜遇到他的。

sentences.english: I just like the sky star, from beginning to end is a supporting role, background.
sentences.chinese: 我就像滿天星，從頭到尾都是配角，背景。

sentences.english: The sky is filled with black plaits .
And just across the street will be the world-renowned Rockefeller Center.
sentences.chinese: 劈面年夜街便是譽滿天下的洛克斐勒中央。

sentences.english: I wish all the teachers happy holidays, have.
sentences.chinese: 祝各位教師節日快樂，桃李滿天下。

sentences.english: I wish you a happy holiday, teachers, students everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 祝各位教師節日快樂，桃李滿天下。

definition: to flutter/to dance in the breeze
Baiyun district of Guiyang city 貴陽市|贵阳市[Gui4 yang2 shi4], Guizhou/Baiyun district of Guangzhou city 廣州市|广州市[Guang3 zhou1 shi4], Guangdong
fine rain/drizzle/poem by Tang poet Li Shangyin 李商隱|李商隐
to swirl in the air (of thickly falling snowflakes, flower petals etc)/to flutter about
(of a city etc) ablaze with lights
to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
